secText:
Essential Question:
How can we calculate the properties of thin lenses?

Enduring Understandings:
1. The reciprocal of the [OBJ:expsec_u283:focal length] of a thin lens is equal to the sum of the reciprocal of the object distance and reciprocal of the image distance.
2. The [OBJ:expsec_u285:magnification] of an object can be calculated by dividing the image height by the object height or by dividing the negative of the image distance by the object distance.

STEM Skills:
1. Review [OBJ:expsec_t574:object and image distance].
2. Review [OBJ:expsec_t574:object and image height].
3. Review [OBJ:expsec_t567:focal length].
